properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 4 at 3:56AM PST until February 5 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Spokane WA
properties.description:
...Active Winter Weather Returns to the Area...

.A Pacific storm system will bring snow to all elevations of the
region beginning Tuesday afternoon and continuing into Wednesday.

* WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 7
inches east of Highway 195, and 2 to 4 inches west of Highway
195.

* WHERE...Pullman, Colfax, Rosalia, La Crosse, Oakesdale, Tekoa,
and Uniontown.

* WHEN...From 4 PM this afternoon to noon PST Wednesday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous
conditions could impact the Tuesday evening commute and
especially the Wednesday morning commute.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light snow will start late this afternoon,
increase in intensity after midnight, with the heaviest snow on
Wednesday morning.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO NOON PST WEDNESDAY
